entry.et: Middle English, from Old English healf; akin to Old High German halb half

def.dt: :either of two equal parts that compose something
:a part approximately equal to one of these half the distance the larger half of the fortune
:half an hour used in designation of time
:one of a pair: as
:partner
:semester term
:either of the two equal periods that together make up the playing time of some games (as football)
:the midpoint in playing time the score was tied at the half
:half-dollar
:halfback
:by a great deal
:in part :halfheartedly
:one-and-a-half times as half again as many
:into two equal or nearly equal parts
:being one of two equal parts a half share a half sheet of paper
:amounting to approximately half a half mile a half million
:falling short of the full or complete thing :partial half measures a half smile
:extending over or covering only half a half window a half mask
:in an equal part or degree the crowd was half jeering, half respectful
:not completely :partially half persuaded
:by any means :at all her singing isn't half bad
:something that is approximately half one thing and half another: as
:a mixture of two malt beverages (as dark and light beer)
:a mixture of cream and whole milk
:lacking significance, adequacy, or completeness
:lacking intelligence, character, or effectiveness
:poorly developed or carried out a half–baked idea half–baked research
:lacking adequate planning or forethought a half–baked scheme for getting rich
:lacking in judgment, intelligence, or common sense
:imperfectly baked :underdone
:a bathroom containing a sink and toilet but no bathtub or shower
:the relation between persons having only one parent in common
:a person so related to another
:half-breed
:grade 4
:having half blood or being a half blood
